EBM has been around for over 40 years and as Australia's leading privately-owned and operated insurance broker you'd be joining over 200 insurance professionals committed to delivering superior risk solutions.


Our success has been achieved by an engaged and dynamic team maintaining a sharp focus on our corporate vision – to be　united in delivering the best outcomes for our clients.


The Opportunity

EBM is currently seeking a Executive Account Manager to join our high performing team based in Sydney. The successful candidate will be accountable for the effective management of a well established successful portfolio as well as identifying growth and business development opportunities to drive further success in EBM’s corporate portfolio.


Key areas of accountability include:

  • Building and maintaining productive client relationships
  • Contributing to growth objectives through business development and retention
  • Identifying and developing new business prospects through cross-marketing
  • Proactive management of client renewal programs and claims
  • Resolving client enquiries and acting as a key point of contact
  • Coaching and mentoring team members


Your Experience

You’ll have solid experience working as a general Insurance Broker whilst having appropriate qualifications in Insurance Broking you take your continuing professional development and compliance requirements very seriously. You have the following skills, knowledge and attributes:

  • Product knowledge across assets, liabilities, personal and financial lines risks.
  • Extensive client facing experience
  • Strong collaboration and negotiation skills
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Superior communication skills


As the successful candidate you’ll have demonstrated the ability to build positive relationships and able to communicate at all levels.


In return you’ll be in a role that challenges, provides access to the significant expertise of colleagues and a client base that offers a diverse range of opportunities.


Applicants must have unrestricted working rights in Australia to apply for this role.

Marketing Manager

Company Name Challenger Limited Company Location Level 2, 5 Martin Place, Sydney, NSW 2000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Challenger Limited is an ASX-listed investment management firm managing more than $81 billion in assets (as at 30 June 2018). Our vision is to provide our customers with financial security for retirement.

\xa0

We achieve this goal by providing a work environment where people from diverse backgrounds, with a range of skills and experiences can contribute and succeed.

\xa0

Our work environment is characterised by the core attributes of Collaborate, Grow, Challenge and Achieve. These attributes represent our commitment to current and future employees.

\xa0

About the opportunity:

\xa0

The Marketing Manager role focuses on creating and implementing effective marketing and communication solutions to grow and support sales efforts for Challenger Life.

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will be a dynamic, results-focussed marketer, with a proven track record in B2B marketing, driving sales and lead generation activities, marketing automation and strong stakeholder management skills.

\xa0

Key responsibilities:

\xa0

  • Developing, driving and executing the marketing strategy, plan and activities to achieve business objectives
  • Designing and executing highly effective demand generation programs utilising the marketing technology stack (Sitecore/Eloqua/Salesforce), across different adviser segments, from concept through execution, that drive and grow marketing qualified leads
  • Leading the performance and development of the Marketing Coordinator and Campaign Managers
  • Working closely with internal clients to support sales activities by designing and executing end-to-end insight driven marketing campaigns/initiatives
  • Creating product campaigns and content used to articulate the features and benefits of our products to advisers
  • Developing and executing on the adviser experience that supports the entire marketing and sales cycle, from initial prospect interest and lead generation to lead nurturing and sales enablement
  • Creating high quality marketing collateral
  • Identifying trends and insights to support marketing and sales initiatives

\xa0

Skills and experience:

\xa0

  • 5+ years of relevant marketing experience in financial services
  • People management experience
  • Proven track record and hands-on experience in demand generation campaigns and tactics (email marketing, inbound marketing, paid search & social, paid advertising, content syndication) and marketing operations (lead management, marketing automation, CRM, marketing technologies, reporting and analytics)
  • Hands on experience in marketing automation platforms such as Eloqua, Marketo or Hubspot
  • Proven experience delivering marketing product support and education throughout the sales cycle
  • Experience in lead nurturing and lead scoring via marketing automation
  • A track record in delivering measurable results that build brands, improves the CX and deliver sound commercial outcomes
  • Developing and maintaining marketing/media budgets


Our Team

\xa0

We enjoy working together as a talented and passionate group. We demonstrate our five core principles of Integrity, Working Together, Creative Customer Solutions, Commercial Ownership and Compliance into everything we do.

\xa0

We offer the opportunity for a broad career experience and value people who are inquisitive and rigorous and are driven to make a difference.

This is reflected in their solid staff retention rate and the internal promotions of several long standing employees.


As an organisation they have continually encouraged staff to undertake professional development and grow within their business.


Reporting to the Project Manager, this role is of paramount importance to their goals. IoT Platform Security Architect

Company Name Weir Minerals Australia Ltd. Company Location Artarmon

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Weir Minerals Australia Ltd, a member of the Weir Group PLC, is the market leader in the design, manufacture and supply of minerals processing equipment to the mining industry, both within Australia and throughout the world.

We currently have a vacancy for a IoT Platform Security Architect to be the lead technologist, driving the security architecture, solution compliance, and best practice across Weir’s IoT and other digital platforms.

\xa0The key responsibilities of this role will include:

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Design, develop and prototype advanced security solutions

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Predict and extrapolate attack trends ahead of their occurrence

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Propose, architect and validate Weir’s digital platform offerings

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Work on innovative solutions to protect the IoT capabilities of Engineering teams

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Perform as a software engineer/technical individual contributor on engineering teams that are developing Weir’s platform solutions

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Develop prototypes or POCs for proving out new technology and validating use-cases that the team considers important to our end-state architecture

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Work across internal teams and stakeholders to educate them and mature product offerings to protect Weir and our customers

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Own and lead platform security testing and compliance activities

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Develop security policy documentation for internal and external stakeholders

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Work with customer facing teams to provide subject matter expertise for customer implementations

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Provide technical individual and group-based seminars/workshops

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Technology development projects align to the Weir New Product Introduction and Agile Development processes

\xb7\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Obtain necessary reporting and approval frameworks are followed for all technology development projects

\xa0

Weir Minerals Australia is a dynamic and growing organisation, so in return for your commitment to us, you will be rewarded with attractive remuneration package including exposure to industry leaders and best practice.


To view the full details for the role and to apply, please submit a cover letter and CV via our careers portal.


Desired Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or\xa0 Programming
  • 5 years of experience in the field of System Security engineering and excel at exploring software and hardware techniques as a method of attack against targets within the computing systems
  • 2 years IoT experience
  • Security expertise over HW, SW, and Firmware domains: from sensors to the cloud
  • Hands-on software development, prototyping and creating production solutions
  • In-depth experience with security threats and vulnerability evaluation along with practicing security development lifecycle best practices including:
    • Threat modeling
    • Security code review, analysis and vulnerability assessment
    • Reverse engineering skills
    • Exploitation and mitigation technique development
    • Security testing techniques fuzzing and pen-testing
    • Expertise in architecting, strategizing and evangelizing advanced product security counter measures into products is valuable
  • Endpoint, network and application security is highly desired
  • Security industry or as a technical leader or architect in a software -development organization
  • Demonstrated knowledge in:
    • Web Application Security including Token Based Authentication (SAML, OAuth, OpenId Connect)
    • SSL Certificates and Mutual TLS Authentication
    • Windows security including BitLocker, Secure Boot
    • IP Networking
    • Industrial protocols such as Modbus, Ethernet IP & Profinet
    • Azure Active Directory
  • Experience in Software Audit, including automated testing for Open Source Components
  • Knowledge of the latest gadgets and building security in to these gadgets

886708933:
[

Administration Manager

Company Name John Holland Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

John Holland, with joint venture partners CPB Contractors and Ghella (JHCPBG JV), have been awarded the contract to deliver the $2.81 billion second stage of Sydney Metro, City and Southwest, Australia’s largest public transport project.

\xa0

With a new crossing under Sydney Harbour, the 15.5 km TBM tunnels will run from Chatswood, through the CBD and then to Marrickville. The project includes building complex underground structures for five new stations in Crows Nest, North Sydney, Barangaroo, Martin Place, Pitt St and Waterloo.

\xa0

We are looking for ‘high performing’ people to join us to deliver this iconic project and leave an amazing legacy for the people of Sydney.

\xa0

DUTIES:

  • Oversee and provide administrative and clerical support for the operations of the TSE Works
  • Train, coach and mentor junior administration staff on PPW and accounts processes
  • Collate multiple projects progress by organising, coordinating, planning, arranging, scheduling, and monitoring results.
  • Prepare documents and reports on financial information, which may include composing budgets, scheduling expenditures, monitoring costs and analysing variances.
  • Prepare monthly submissions, as directed by senior management
  • Maintain Project records, and ensure information is accurate, up-to-date and stored safely
  • Manage the physical office space, establishing administration policies, procedures, and work schedules
  • Provide stakeholder support, which may involve working with entry level employees, senior management, clients and suppliers
  • Manage and coordinate project completion archiving
  • Organise events that are relevant to the TSE Works
  • Communicate job expectations to direct reports, which may include monitoring, coaching, and disciplining employees as appropriate.
  • Perform all tasks assigned to you with respect to the realisation of positive performance indicators mandated by the project, e.g. Monthly Safety Activity Summaries and Personal Safety Activity Summaries.
  • Ensure office WH&S across all team functions in line with WH&S management plan and safety legislation
  • Ensure the administration team provide adequate support to the office.

\xa0

RESPONSIBILITY TO TEAM MEMBERS :

  • Ensure team members have a clear understanding of their role purpose and accountabilities, supported by a current Responsibility Statement aligned with the project objectives.
  • Ensure that clear performance objectives are in place for the team, measure and manage progress against objectives
  • Provide and obtain regular constructive feedback and coaching and/or mentoring as appropriate
  • Ensure understanding and provide guidance of WH&S management plan all employees
  • Review (on-going) team members’ competencies and identify training and development needs

\xa0

REQUIREMENTS FOR THE POSITION :

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in senior Administrative positions (ideally in construction or similar)
  • Relevant WH&S / OH&S Safety qualifications
  • Excellent MS Office skills (preferable advances in word and excel)
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills
  • Ability to communicate and report to high level senior stakeholders\xa0\xa0

\xa0

Salary in the region of $80,000 - $90,000 including super.\xa0

\xa0

JHCPBG understand that our greatest resource is our people and promote a culture where ‘Exceptional is Standard’. We pride ourselves on being a market leader in targeting training, career development and remuneration. We provide long-term career options within an equal opportunity workplace where we recognise the importance of flexibility and a healthy work-life balance.

\xa0

Please follow the link to submit your application outlining your relevant experience with regards to the position you are applying for.

\xa0

\xa0

Note: these roles are being sourced by JHCPBG directly and we will not accept unsolicited applications via external recruitment agencies.\xa0

\xa0


Desired Skills and Experience

A career opportunity on the $2.81 bn Sydney Metro TSE Project.

Job description

About Us

HomeAway.com, an Expedia Inc. company are the leading vacation rental website in the world with more than 1.2 million online bookable vacation rentals in over 190 countries. As a leading Employer of Choice with 4000 employees in 19 countries across Europe, Americas and the Asia Pacific we pride ourselves in fostering an empowering, creative and innovative culture. At HomeAway, our mission is to make every vacation rental in the world available to every traveller in the world through our online marketplace and we're committed to helping families and friends find the perfect vacation rental to create unforgettable travel experiences together.

Some of the perks you will enjoy
  • The opportunity to be yourself – casual dress code every day.
  • Annual target bonus.
  • A fully stocked kitchen, catered lunches and free coffee.
  • Stunning offices with 180-degree views of the harbour, break out areas and table tennis.
  • Training and development to expand your career.
  • Work with the latest technology.
  • Health insurance benefits available.
  • Flexible, transparent and empowering work culture.
    Purpose of the role

    We are seeking a client centric, passionate and resourceful Implementation Specialist with creative thinking skills to be a part of our Global Implementation Team, owning projects from discovery through to completion and post implementation support. You will be primarily responsible for onboarding listings and ecommerce feeds for Property Managers (PMs) to ensure that their content remains accurate, working with third party software’s to ensure a smooth customer experience and providing ongoing support and metrics to support our client base.

    As an Implementations Specialist, you will be responsible for
  • Working with Property Managers and their Property Management Software Companies to activate listings content and online booking feeds on HomeAway.
  • Managing integration go-live periods, and actively driving to solve problems by working closely with internal teams to ensure a smooth customer experience for the PM.
  • Maintain continual communication with the PM’s and key stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle, while juggling many smaller projects simultaneously.
  • Providing recommendations, and contributing to, guidelines around customer performance and ecommerce best practices.
  • Tracking and providing metrics related to personal and team performance, as well as various projects, all with the goal of providing excellent customer service
  • Participating in and managing pilot projects when new software integrations are launched.
  • If necessary, you may also project manage other PM-related projects, and be able to provide user acceptance testing and feedback on tools related to PM activations.
To be successful in this role you will demonstrate
  • Experience with HTML or XML (necessary
  • 2-4 years experience in Implementation Management, Client Services Project Management or Engagement Management
  • We keep you busy in this role. That's why having 2-4 years of project management experience and being able to successfully handle multiple projects for 30+ clients at varying stages will help you succeed.
  • You are a dedicated, detailed problem solver who can identify complexities and maintain ownership of processes and resolving issues. Do you have proven detective skills? If yes, this job is for you!
  • Knowing how to speak to your audience - you will need to adjust communication for different audiences based on technical experience and provide appropriate training.
  • Be comfortable with changes. We want to improve our processes continuously andsee changes as a way to grow and improve. You should also be good at self-directing andmaking independent and solid judgments based on information available.
  • Do you enjoy learning new technical concepts and have you shown you can do soquickly? There is always something new to learn.
  • Demonstrate experience as a team-player and be looking forward to joining a teamthat we are proud to call our work family.
  • Experience with Salesforce.com and with issue-tracking software (JIRA, Rally, etc.)(preferred).
  • A Bachelor’s degree or higher is required
  • Excel experience (V-Lookups and Pivot tables)
  • Fluent in Japanese (not essential)

  • 7+ years’ experience as a Project Manager and 1-2 years as Program Manager in a similar role
  • Exceptional people and relationship building skills\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0
  • An empathetic approach to diverse ways of thinking and working
  • A creative spirit and adaptable outlook
  • An organised and methodical working pattern with high attention to detail.\xa0


Perks of working in our Tribe:

  • Working with a leading Australian luxury fashion brand and be a part of our growth and journey to colour the world
  • We aim to empower our Tribe with a focus on individual personal development
  • We offer a holistic Health and Wellbeing program including meditation and yoga
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • We offer generous staff discounts and a uniform allowance as well as regular sample sales

\xa0

If this sounds like you, please float on over and apply now! xx

\xa0

884742546:
[

Proposals Manager

Company Name CAE Australia Company Location Unit 40 Slough Avenue , Silverwater, NSW 2128, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Role Overview
Working within CAE’s Defence & Security business, the Proposal Manager will be responsible and accountable for the planning, development, validation and delivery of compliant, professionally produced proposals within customer-defined timeframes. This is a highly networked role that requires an ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines.

The Proposal Manager should be an accomplished leader who understands project management, contracts, and business capture. The preferred candidate will have proven successful experience in proposals development and will have some familiarity with the Defence industry in order to be conversant in their terminology, policies, organizational structure, etc.


Core Responsibilities:

  • Manage and direct all proposal efforts and personnel to co-ordinate and produce the proposal response.
  • Ensure bid strategy is defined and aligned with win strategy.
  • Review solicitation documents to understand the proposal deliverables, capture the customer’s issues and needs and translate them into winning themes.
  • Direct the creation and review of a proposal outline and writing assignments plan.
  • Coordinate and review/edit proposal input from a variety of stakeholders, typically involving contributions from business development, engineering, project management, product teams, finance, commercial, legal, etc.
  • Assist in analysing the solicitation document requirements against the proposal response document to ensure compliance and responsiveness to the customer’s needs.
  • Conduct regular proposal progress status meetings and maintain the proposal development schedule
  • Lead preparation of and present to management all proposal gate review material.
  • Interact with various business functions across the organisation, including business development, training solutions, program management, operations, engineering, legal, etc., during the preparation and validation of the proposal.
  • Generate proposal development budget estimates and manage allocated budget.
  • Negotiate and validate workshare allocations between global CAE sites for intercompany proposals.
  • Support business growth and continuous improvement initiatives, as directed by the head of bids/capture.\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0


  • Knowledge, Skills and Personal Attributes
  • Possesses highly developed leadership and communication acumen.
  • Can communicate and influence at a senior level
  • Experienced in scheduling and running proposal kick-off meetings, leading storyboarding sessions, facilitating key review meetings /final document review, co-ordinating proposal governance /sign off, document production and delivery of the completed proposal.
  • Ability to coach capture team members and proposal contributors in proposal best practices
  • Proven ability in planning, producing and delivering compliant proposals within a complex business environment.
  • Has the ability to manage and motivate proposal development teams, develop and maintain relationships with internal staff and ensure a high level of service.
  • Can demonstrate initiative and the ability to multi-task, while successfully managing conflicting deadlines.
  • Is outcome-focused, with a drive to deliver professional, quality offerings.
  • Possesses excellent attention to detail


  • Highly Desirable:

  • Capable of obtaining Defence security clearance and access to ITAR data
  • An understanding of ASDEFCON and Defence proposal process and Defence procurement practices
  • Experience writing proposals, preferably Government/Defence pursuits
  • Project management experience


Note:\xa0As the Australian Department of Defence is a major client, you\xa0must\xa0be eligible for SECRET (NV1) level Defence security clearance, and preferably already hold a current SECRET (NV1) clearance.


EEO Statement:

CAE is firmly committed to ensuring a positive and professional working environment in which all people are treated with dignity and respect. We aim to provide a fair and consistent method for filling job openings in support of equality of opportunity and cultural diversity within the company.
